page.title: 14CONSERVATION IN SADDLEWORTH
page.content: There is an ongoing project at Rye Top Farm, Knowl Top, & a completed one at adjacent Knowl Farm, run by the local Groundwork Trust in conjunction with the British Trust for Conservation Volunteers. The Groundwork Trust can arrange with landowners to utilise grants from the Countryside Commission (50% for tree-planting & some for the restoration of stone walls) in such areas as this, which was at one time covered with trees. Also at Knowl Farm there has been hedge-planting, & the erection of protective fencing against sheep, to aid this conservation work. There is also ongoing work on our section of the Huddersfield Narrow Canal, with five local locks being restored, to revitalise the whole stretch to Uppermill & beyond. Greater Manchester Council is helping to fund this canal conservation work.
